00068 template<typename T>

00073

00075

00094         
00099         static bool dataIsSequential( Idx<T>& idx );    
00100         
00102         /* 
00103          * TODO: is this static allocation worth it, or should it be 
00104          * dynamically allocated?
00105          * 
00106          * NOTE: Do not expose this to users, at least not if this iterator 
00107          * is iterating over contiguous memory. Because in that case, 
00108          * inds are not updated.
00109          */
00110         int inds[MAXDIMS];
00111         
00113         IdxSpec& spec;
00114         
00116         T* data;
00117         
00119         T* dataEnd;
00120         
00125         bool isSimpleIteration;
00127         //enum IncrPolicy{ CONTIGUOUS, NONCONTIGUOUS, NUM_OF_INCRPOLICIES };
00128         //IncrPolicy incrPolicy;
00129 
00130 //      // Purely to check that two iterators are iterating over the same Idx.
00131 //      const Idx<T>* const idxPtr;

00138

00144                 
00145         // TODO: should we even have incr_contiguous and decr_contiguous?
00146         // They keep us from letting users use inds[], since the inds are
00147         // not updated in incr_contiguous.
00148         
00150         inline void incr_contiguous();
00151

00172 template<typename T>
00173 class ScalarIter : public ScalarIter_Base<T>, public std::iterator<std::bidirectional_iterator_tag, T>{
00174 
00175 
00176         // If we were to define these inline friend functions in another 
00177         // file, we'd need to endure a gcc warning making sure that we 
00178         // know it's not a template function. Until we figure
00179         // out how to disable that warning for just this file, 
00180         // we define the functions in place to avoid the nagging:
00181         
00186         inline friend bool operator==( const ScalarIter<T>& aa, const ScalarIter<T>& bb ){
00187                 return aa.data == bb.data; //return static_cast<const ScalarIter_Base<T>&>(aa) == static_cast<const ScalarIter_Base<T>&>(bb);           
00188         }
00189         
00194         inline friend bool operator!=( const ScalarIter<T>& aa, const ScalarIter<T>& bb ){
00195                 return !(aa == bb);
00196         }
00197         
00198 public: 
00199         
00208         ScalarIter( Idx<T>& idx, bool atBeginning = true );
00209         
00211         ScalarIter( const ScalarIter<T>& other );
00212         
00214         ScalarIter& operator++();
00215         
00217         ScalarIter operator++(int);
00218         
00220         ScalarIter& operator--();
00221         
00223         ScalarIter operator--(int);
00224         
00225 };

00234 template<typename T>
00235 class ReverseScalarIter : public ScalarIter_Base<T>, public std::iterator<std::bidirectional_iterator_tag, T>{
00236         
00241         inline friend bool operator==( const ReverseScalarIter<T>& aa, const ReverseScalarIter<T>& bb ){
00242                 return aa.data == bb.data; //return static_cast<const ScalarIter_Base<T>&>(aa) == static_cast<const ScalarIter_Base<T>&>(bb);           
00243         }
00244         
00249         inline friend bool operator!=( const ReverseScalarIter<T>& aa, const ReverseScalarIter<T>& bb ){
00250                 return !(aa == bb);
00251         }       
00252         
00253 public:
00254         
00256         ReverseScalarIter( Idx<T>& idx, bool isBeginning = true );
00257 
00259         inline ReverseScalarIter& operator++();
00260
